talk.author: did:plc:lw7hallqsgrhwumgudkph44j
talk.utter:
Well...

There is outstanding cheddar here.

But it's not common to the shops.

If you want to get decadent I think Hooks 12 year old is better than the 15, but both are incredible cheeses (and I'm hoping to get some of both again, at some point)

(and tillamook is ok, but I agree it's not on a par)

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg
talk.utter: When I've bought US cheddar in the US at cheese counters it's never quite been as good as the top cheddar here. It's been really nice, but not *cheddar* cheddar nice.

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg
talk.utter: When I've bought US cheddar in the US at cheese counters it's never quite been as good as the top cheddar here. It's been really nice, but not *cheddar* cheddar nice.

talk.utter: Cheese-loving American here: totally agree. There’s nothing like a crystally British cheddar. I just wish mozzarella di bufala was more common here - the shelf life is so short it’s hard to import (and very expensive)

talk.author: did:plc:46hrjyqrvkaf2ineynk4syf7
talk.utter: I've had imported farmhouse stuff. It's...fine, if you're eating it on crackers; but in a sandwich, the crystals just fall apart. Different use cases. (I found the crystalline texture unpleasant, personally. Like someone left toast crumbs in my cheese.)

talk.utter: As an Australian living in the US, I find that American cheddar is generally ok, despite the colour. You can find good cheddar here without too much trouble.

talk.author: did:plc:nvfznp5ls3wcf6aktlfkfkp3
talk.utter: My question is, is prepackaged mass produced cheese actually good anywhere in the world?

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg
talk.utter:
The mature cheddar we can buy in supermarkets is on a par with counter cheddar I have had in the US.

In Italy the prepackaged mass produces parmesan is as good as what you'd get at a counter elsewhere.

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg
talk.utter:
The mature cheddar we can buy in supermarkets is on a par with counter cheddar I have had in the US.

talk.author: did:plc:nvfznp5ls3wcf6aktlfkfkp3
talk.utter: Oh god the prepacked parmesan here Is TERRIBLE.

talk.author: did:plc:nvfznp5ls3wcf6aktlfkfkp3
talk.utter: Luckily it's very easy to find really high quality good parmesan at grocery stores just not in the refrigerated cheese aisle.

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg
talk.utter: Honestly it's not very easy to get quality parmesan here unless you go to an Italian deli. Most cheese shops wouldn't stock it because its not like you'd take it to a party or whatever.

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg

talk.author: did:plc:nvfznp5ls3wcf6aktlfkfkp3

talk.author: did:plc:hu2obebw3nhfj667522dahfg
talk.utter:
The best cheddar at a US counter will be imported from the UK (at least in my experience).

You guys do awesome other cheeses though no doubt. Just not the sharp crystally kind in the main.
